summary.purpose: Provides general-purpose utility functions used across the server application, including environment variable initialization, JSON response builders, error parsing, version reading, geo-coding, type utilities, and HTTP helpers.
summary.problem_solved: Centralizes common server-side operations like environment validation, standardized API response formatting, address resolution from coordinates, object sanitization, and SSL-aware HTTP requests to avoid code duplication across services.

external.name: axios
external.why_used: HTTP client for making geocode API requests and general HTTP requests with configurable SSL settings

external.name: https
external.why_used: Node.js built-in module used to create an HTTPS agent that disables SSL verification in QA environments

external.name: fs
external.why_used: Node.js built-in module used to read package.json for version extraction via readFileSync

external.name: akeyless-types-commons
external.why_used: Shared type definitions (Geo, LanguageOptions, TObject) used across the akeyless ecosystem

exports.name: init_env_variables
exports.description_one_line: Validates required environment variables exist and returns all env vars as a typed object

exports.name: json_ok
exports.description_one_line: Creates a standardized success JSON response with data payload

exports.name: json_failed
exports.description_one_line: Creates a standardized failure JSON response with error details

exports.name: parse_error
exports.description_one_line: Extracts name and message from Error objects or returns raw error value

exports.name: get_version
exports.description_one_line: Reads and returns the version string from a package.json file

exports.name: sleep
exports.description_one_line: Returns a promise that resolves after the specified number of milliseconds

exports.name: get_nx_service_urls
exports.description_one_line: Returns the base URL map for all NX services based on the current environment

exports.name: get_address_by_geo
exports.description_one_line: Resolves geographic coordinates to a formatted street address using Google Geocoding API

exports.name: validate_and_cast
exports.description_one_line: Type guard that validates a condition and narrows the type of a variable

exports.name: get_or_default
exports.description_one_line: Returns the value if defined, otherwise returns the default value or invokes a default factory function

exports.name: trim_strings
exports.description_one_line: Recursively trims all string values in an object, array, or standalone string

exports.name: remove_nulls_and_undefined
exports.description_one_line: Removes all null and undefined values from a flat object

exports.name: ignore_ssl_request
exports.description_one_line: Makes an HTTP request via axios, disabling SSL verification in QA environments

symbols.name: init_env_variables
symbols.description_one_line: Validates required environment variables exist and returns all env vars as a typed object

params.name: required_vars
params.description: Array of environment variable names that must be present. Defaults to empty array.

returns.description: An object mapping all environment variable names to their string values

details.what_it_does: Iterates through the required_vars array and checks that each environment variable is defined in process.env. If any required variable is missing, it logs an error and terminates the process with exit code 1. After validation, it collects all environment variables into a typed object and returns it.
side_effects: Logs an error via logger.error if a required variable is missing
Calls process.exit(1) if any required variable is missing, terminating the process
error_cases: Terminates the process if any variable listed in required_vars is not set in process.env

minimal_correct.title: Validate mode and port environment variables

incorrect.title: Missing required variable causes process exit
incorrect.why_incorrect: Calling with a required variable that is not set will terminate the entire process.

symbols.name: json_ok
symbols.description_one_line: Creates a standardized success JSON response with data payload

params.name: data
params.description: The data payload to include in the response

returns.type: { success: true; data: TObject<any> | TObject<any>[] | undefined }
returns.description: A success response object with success=true and the data payload

details.what_it_does: Wraps a data payload into a standardized success response object with `success: true` and the provided data. Used as a consistent API response format across all endpoints.

minimal_correct.title: Return a success response from an Express handler

symbols.name: json_failed
symbols.description_one_line: Creates a standardized failure JSON response with error details

params.name: error
params.description: The error object or message. If an Error instance, error.message is used.

returns.type: { success: false; error: any; msg: string | undefined }
returns.description: A failure response object with success=false, the error details, and optional message

details.what_it_does: Creates a standardized error response object. Extracts the message from Error instances, falls back to the raw error value, or defaults to a generic message string. Includes an optional msg field for additional context.

minimal_correct.title: Return an error response from an Express handler

symbols.name: parse_error
symbols.description_one_line: Extracts name and message from Error objects or returns raw error value

params.name: error
params.description: The error to parse, can be an Error instance or any value

returns.description: A simplified error object with name and message if Error instance, otherwise the raw value

details.what_it_does: Checks if the error is an instance of Error. If so, returns a plain object with just the name and message properties. Otherwise returns the error as-is. Useful for serializing errors to JSON where Error instances lose their properties.

minimal_correct.title: Parse an Error instance

symbols.name: get_version
symbols.description_one_line: Reads and returns the version string from a package.json file

params.name: packageJsonPath
params.description: Absolute or relative file path to the package.json file

returns.description: The version string from the package.json file

details.what_it_does: Reads the specified package.json file synchronously, parses it as JSON, and returns the version field. Typically used at server startup to log the current service version.
error_cases: Throws if the file does not exist or is not valid JSON

minimal_correct.title: Get current project version

symbols.name: sleep
symbols.description_one_line: Returns a promise that resolves after the specified number of milliseconds

params.name: ms
params.description: Duration in milliseconds to wait. Defaults to 2500.

returns.description: A promise that resolves after the specified delay

details.what_it_does: Creates a promise that resolves after a setTimeout of the given milliseconds. Useful for adding delays in async flows such as retry logic or rate limiting.

minimal_correct.title: Wait 1 second before retrying

symbols.name: BASE_URLS
symbols.description_one_line: Static mapping of environment names (local, prod, qa) to NX service base URLs

returns.description: A record mapping environment names to objects containing base URLs for all NX services

details.what_it_does: Defines the base URLs for all NX microservices (bi, call_center, dashboard, devices, end_users, notifications, installer, ox_server, toolbox) across three environments: local (localhost ports), prod (nx-api.info domain), and qa (nx-api.xyz domain). This is a private constant used by get_nx_service_urls.

symbols.name: get_nx_service_urls
symbols.description_one_line: Returns the base URL map for all NX services based on the current environment

params.name: env_name
params.description: The name of the environment variable to read. Defaults to 'mode'.

returns.description: An object mapping NX service names to their base URLs for the resolved environment

details.what_it_does: Reads the environment variable specified by env_name (defaulting to 'mode'), determines the environment ('prod' for 'production'/'prod', 'qa' for 'qa', otherwise 'local'), and returns the corresponding URL map from BASE_URLS.
error_cases: Throws an Error if the specified environment variable is not set

minimal_correct.title: Get service URLs for current environment

symbols.name: get_address_by_geo
symbols.description_one_line: Resolves geographic coordinates to a formatted street address using Google Geocoding API

params.name: { lat, lng }
params.description: Geographic coordinates with lat and lng properties

params.name: currentLanguage
params.description: The language for the returned address (Hebrew maps to 'iw', otherwise 'en')

returns.description: The formatted address string truncated to 35 characters, or empty string if not found or coordinates are invalid

details.what_it_does: Validates that coordinates are within valid lat/lng ranges. Retrieves the Google Geocoding API key from cache_manager settings. Makes a request to the Google Geocoding API and returns the first result's formatted address (truncated to 35 chars). Returns empty string for invalid coordinates, missing results, or API errors.
side_effects: Makes an HTTP request to Google Geocoding API
error_cases: Throws an Error if the Google API key is not found in cache_manager settings
Logs and swallows HTTP/API errors, returning empty string

minimal_correct.title: Resolve coordinates to an address

symbols.name: validate_and_cast
symbols.description_one_line: Type guard that validates a condition and narrows the type of a variable

params.name: variable
params.description: The variable whose type should be narrowed

params.name: condition
params.description: The boolean condition that, when true, confirms the variable is of type T

returns.description: A type predicate that narrows the variable to type T when true

details.what_it_does: Acts as a TypeScript type guard. Returns !!condition, narrowing the type of the variable to the generic parameter T when the condition is truthy. Useful for runtime type checks that also satisfy the TypeScript compiler.

minimal_correct.title: Validate and narrow type

symbols.name: get_or_default
symbols.description_one_line: Returns the value if defined, otherwise returns the default value or invokes a default factory function

params.name: default_value
params.description: The fallback value or a factory function that produces the fallback value

returns.description: The original value if not undefined, otherwise the default value (or result of calling the factory)

details.what_it_does: Checks if the value is not undefined. If defined, returns it directly. If undefined, checks whether default_value is a function - if so, calls it and returns the result; otherwise returns default_value directly. This supports both static defaults and lazy/computed defaults.

minimal_correct.title: Use with static and factory defaults
minimal_correct.code:
import { get_or_default } from 'akeyless-server-commons';

get_or_default(undefined, 'fallback');  // 'fallback'
get_or_default('actual', 'fallback');   // 'actual'
get_or_default(undefined, () => new Date()); // Date instance (lazy)

symbols.name: trim_strings
symbols.description_one_line: Recursively trims all string values in an object, array, or standalone string

params.name: input
params.description: The value to trim - can be a string, array, object, or any other type

returns.description: The input with all string values trimmed. Non-string primitives, Date, RegExp, Map, Set are returned as-is.

details.what_it_does: Recursively traverses the input. If the input is a string, trims whitespace. If it is an array, maps each element through trim_strings. If it is a plain object (excluding Date, RegExp, Map, Set), creates a new object with all string property values trimmed. All other types are returned unchanged. This is useful for sanitizing user input before storing in a database.

minimal_correct.title: Trim strings in a nested object

symbols.name: remove_nulls_and_undefined
symbols.description_one_line: Removes all null and undefined values from a flat object

returns.description: A new object with all null and undefined entries removed

details.what_it_does: Creates a new object from the entries of the input, filtering out any entries where the value is null or undefined. Does not recurse into nested objects. Useful for preparing data for Firestore or API payloads where null/undefined fields should be omitted.

minimal_correct.title: Clean an object before saving

symbols.name: ignore_ssl_request
symbols.description_one_line: Makes an HTTP request via axios, disabling SSL verification in QA environments

params.name: config
params.description: The axios request configuration object (url, method, data, headers, etc.)

details.what_it_does: First calls init_env_variables to retrieve the 'mode' environment variable. If the mode is 'qa', attaches an HTTPS agent with rejectUnauthorized=false to the config, effectively disabling SSL certificate verification. Then executes the request via axios and returns the response. This is useful for QA environments that use self-signed certificates.
side_effects: Calls init_env_variables which may terminate the process if 'mode' is not set
Disables SSL verification in QA mode (security implication)

minimal_correct.title: Make a request that works in QA with self-signed certs
